frame.name: Food
frame.definition:
<def-root>This frame contains words referring to items of food.
<ex>Specialties include deep fried shredded beef , duck , prawn dishes and <fex name="Descriptor">hand-made</fex> <t>noodles</t>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Descriptor
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE indicates a characteristic or description of the food. <ex> She drinks <fex name="Desc">low-fat</fex> <t>milk</t></ex></def-root>

FE.name: Type
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies a particular <fen>Type</fen> of the food item. <ex> <fex name="Type">cooking</fex> <t>apple</t></ex> <ex><fex name="Type">Granny Smith</fex> <t>apple</t>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Constituent_parts
FE.definition:
<def-root>A part of the <fen>Food</fen>.
<ex>You'd be surprised, but it was hard to eat a <t>banana</t> <fex name="Constituent_parts">with such a thick peel</fex>.</ex></def-root>

lexUnit.name: fruit.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: the sweet and fleshy product of a tree or other plant that contains seed and can be eaten as food.

lexUnit.name: apple.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: the rounded fruit of a tree of the rose family, with green or red skin and crisp flesh.

lexUnit.name: banana.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a long curved fruit which grows in clusters and has soft pulpy flesh and yellow skin when ripe.

lexUnit.name: vegetable.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: 1. a plant or part of a plant used as food. [Food]

lexUnit.name: carrot.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a tapering orange-coloured root eaten as a vegetable

lexUnit.name: potato.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a starchy plant tuber which is one of the most important food crops, cooked and eaten as a vegetable

lexUnit.name: pea.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a spherical green seed eaten as a vegetable

lexUnit.name: meat.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: the flesh of an animal (especially a mammal) as food.

lexUnit.name: beef.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: the flesh of a cow, bull, or ox, used as food. [Food]

lexUnit.name: lamb.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: 1. a young sheep. [Zool] [Food]

lexUnit.name: veal.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: mass noun the flesh of a calf, used as food.

lexUnit.name: poultry.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: .mass noun chickens, turkeys, ducks, and geese; domestic fowl.

lexUnit.name: chicken.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a domestic fowl kept for its eggs or meat, especially a young one

lexUnit.name: turkey.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a large mainly domesticated game bird native to North America, having a bald head and (in the male) red wattles. Meleagris gallopavo. [Bird] NB: as used for food.

lexUnit.name: fish.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: mass noun the flesh of fish as food.

lexUnit.name: salmon.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the flesh of a large edible fish that matures in the sea and migrates to freshwater streams to spawn as food

lexUnit.name: tuna.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: pl. same or tunas a large and active predatory schooling fish of warm seas, extensively fished commercially, as used for food.

lexUnit.name: shellfish.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: pl. same an aquatic shelled mollusc or crustacean, especially an edible one. [Invert]

lexUnit.name: shrimp.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a small free-swimming edible crustacean with ten legs, mainly marine

lexUnit.name: lobster.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the flesh of a large marine crustacean with a cylindrical body, stalked eyes, and the first of its five pairs of limbs modified as pincers as food. [Food]

lexUnit.name: milk.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: the milk of cows as a food and drink for humans

lexUnit.name: cheese.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a food made from the pressed curds of milk, having a texture either firm and elastic or soft and semi-liquid

lexUnit.name: egg.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: an infertile egg, typically of the domestic hen, used for food

lexUnit.name: butter.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: mass noun a pale yellow edible fatty substance made by churning cream and used as a spread or in cooking.

lexUnit.name: nut.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a fruit consisting of a hard or tough shell around an edible kernel

lexUnit.name: almond.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: the oval edible nut-like kernel of the almond tree, growing in a woody shell.

lexUnit.name: peanut.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: the oval seed of a South American plant, eaten as a snack or used for making oil or animal feed. [Food]

lexUnit.name: pasta.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: mass noun dough extruded or stamped into various shapes (e.g. spaghetti, lasagne) for cookin in boiling water and eating, typically with a savoury sauce.

lexUnit.name: noodle.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: usu. noodles a very thin, long strip of pasta or a similar flour paste.

lexUnit.name: herb.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: any plant with leaves, seeds, or flowers used for flavouring, food, medicine, or perfume.

lexUnit.name: spice.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: an aromatic or pungent vegetable substance used to flavour food, e.g. pepper

lexUnit.name: pepper.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a pungent, hot-tasting powder prepared from dried and ground peppercorns, used to flavour food.

lexUnit.name: basil.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: an aromatic plant of the mint family, native to tropical Asia, used as a culinary herb.

lexUnit.name: cereal.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: mass noun a breakfast food made from a cereal grain or grains.

lexUnit.name: lettuce.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: cultivated plant of the daisy family, with edible leaves that are eaten in salads

lexUnit.name: berry.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a small roundish juicy fruit without a stone.

lexUnit.name: bread.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: food made of flour, water, and yeast mixed together and baked.

lexUnit.name: roll.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a very small loaf of bread

lexUnit.name: cracker.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a thin dry biscuit, typically eaten with cheese

lexUnit.name: cake.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: an item of soft sweet food made from baking a mixture of flour, fat, eggs, sugar, etc.

lexUnit.name: pancake.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a thin, flat cake of batter, fried and turned in a pan and typically rolled up with a sweet or savoury filling. [Savoury] [Sweet]

lexUnit.name: cheesecake.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a kind of rich sweet tart made with cream and soft cheese on a biscuit base, typically topped with fruit.

lexUnit.name: pastry.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: an item of food consisting of sweet pastry with a cream, jam, or fruit filling.

lexUnit.name: croissant.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a French crescent-shaped roll made of sweet flaky pastry, eaten for breakfast.

lexUnit.name: cookie.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a sweet biscuit.

lexUnit.name: biscuit.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a.Brit. a small, flat, crisp unleavened cake.

lexUnit.name: sweet.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a small shaped piece of confectionery made with sugar.

lexUnit.name: chocolate.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a food made from roasted and ground cacao seeds, typically sweetened and eaten as confectionery.

lexUnit.name: sweetener.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: 1. a substance used to sweeten food or drink, especially one other than sugar.

lexUnit.name: sugar.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: mass noun a sweet crystalline substance obtained especially from sugar cane and sugar beet, consisting essentially of sucrose and used as a sweetener in food and drink. [Food]

lexUnit.name: honey.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a sweet, sticky yellowish-brown fluid made by bees and other insects from flower nectar.

lexUnit.name: fat.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: such a substance, or a similar one made from plants, used in cooking. [Food]

lexUnit.name: oil.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: with modifier any of various viscous liquids which are insoluble in water but soluble in organic solvents and are obtained from animals or plants, as used for cooking

lexUnit.name: vinegar.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a sour-tasting liquid containing acetic acid, obtained by fermenting dilute alcoholic liquids, typically wine, cider, or beer, and used as a condiment or for pickling

lexUnit.name: coffee.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a hot drink made from the roasted and ground bean-like seeds of a tropical shrub.

lexUnit.name: juice.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: the liquid present in fruit or vegetables, often used for drinks

lexUnit.name: soup.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a savoury liquid dish made by boiling meat, fish, or vegetables in stock or water.

lexUnit.name: stew.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a dish of meat and vegetables cooked slowly in liquid in a closed dish or pan.

lexUnit.name: sauce.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: thick liquid served with food to add moistness and flavour.

lexUnit.name: dressing.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: also salad dressing mass noun a sauce for salads, usually consisting of oil and vinegar with herbs or other flavourings.

lexUnit.name: vinaigrette.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: salad dressing of oil, wine vinegar, and seasoning.

lexUnit.name: ketchup.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: mass noun a spicy sauce made chiefly from tomatoes and vinegar, used as a relish.

lexUnit.name: mayonnaise.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: mass noun a thick creamy dressing consisting of egg yolks beaten with oil and vinegar.

lexUnit.name: lasagne.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: an Italian dish consisting of [pasta in wide sheets or strips] baked with meat or vegetables in a cheese sauce

lexUnit.name: food.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: any nutritious substance that people or animals eat or drink or that plants absorb in order to maintain life and growth.

lexUnit.name: tea.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a hot drink made by infusing the dried, crushed leaves of the tea plant in boiling water.

lexUnit.name: water.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: mass noun; an odorless, tasteless drink of H2O

lexUnit.name: date.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: sweet edible fruit of the date palm

lexUnit.name: cabbage.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: (the leaves of) a cruciferous vegetable, often eaten boiled.

lexUnit.name: MRE.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: (Meal, Ready to Eat) a field ration served by the US military.

lexUnit.name: beer.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: an alcoholic beverage made from malted grain fermented by yeast, usually flavored with hops.
